data.scheme_name: Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Scheme for assistance to MSMEs - EPF Reimbursement to MSMEs - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides the benefit of reimbursing 100% of the employer's statutory EPF contribution for new employees in Gujarat, for up to 10 years, with a ceiling of 12% of the employee's basic salary plus DA and retaining allowance, or INR 1800 per month, whichever is lower.
data.eligibility: 1. A existing enterprise that expands or diversifies and begins commercial production or services within the scheme's operative period will be eligible for the scheme.
data.conditions:
1. Assistance is available for new employees added during expansion/diversification. 
  2. A new employee is one without a prior Universal Account Number (UAN) who joins during the scheme's period. 
  3. Reimbursement is done quarterly based on submitted payment receipts. 
  4. MSMEs that have received EPF reimbursement from any government scheme are not eligible for this scheme during that period.
data.beneficiaries: 1. A existing enterprise that expands or diversifies and begins commercial production or services within the scheme's operative period will be eligible for the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Assistance is available for new employees added during expansion/diversification. 
  2. A new employee is one without a prior Universal Account Number (UAN) who joins during the scheme's period. 
  3. Reimbursement is done quarterly based on submitted payment receipts. 
  4. MSMEs that have received EPF reimbursement from any government scheme are not eligible for this scheme during that period.
data.context: The Scheme is launched to boost MSME growth and strengthen the overall ecosystem in the State and help achieve the larger goal of an Aatmanirbhar Gujarat for Aatmanirbhar Bharat.
data.objective: To provide EPF reimbursements to MSMEs for ease of doing business.
data.description: The scheme provides the benefit of reimbursing 100% of the employer's statutory EPF contribution for new employees in Gujarat, for up to 10 years, with a ceiling of 12% of the employee's basic salary plus DA and retaining allowance, or INR 1800 per month, whichever is lower.
data.how_to_apply: Applicants can apply online within one year from the date of first disbursement of loan, or on or before the date of commencement of commercial production, whichever is later.
data.funding_facilitator:
Micro, Small : General Manager - DIC
Medium : MSME Commissioner
data.funding_mechanism: Reimbursement shall be made by the disbursing authority after the approval.
data.additional_info:
General Assistance Guidelines: - Enterprises that receive assistance under this component are ineligible for similar benefits under other state government schemes. - Eligibility for Government of India schemes remains intact even if assistance is availed from the state. Categories of Locations for Subsidy: 

  • Category I: Includes areas such as: Dholera, Detroj - Rampura, Dhanduka, Khamba, Dhari, Lilia, Savar Kundla, Babra, Kunkavav Vadia, Lathi, Tarapur, Anklav, Sojitra, Dhansura, Malpur, Lakhani, Amirgadh, Suigam, Danta, Dhanera, Vav, Kankrej, Vadgam, Tharad, Deodar, Dantiwada, Netrang, Jesar, Umrala, Vallabhipur, Gariadhar, Palitana, Talaja, Ghogha, Ranpur, Gadhada, Barwala, Botad, Chhota Udepur, Kavant, Nasvadi, Sankheda, Bodeli, Jetpur Pavi, Kalyanpur, Bhanvad, Dhanpur, Sanjeli, Limkheda, Dahod, Fatepura, Jhalod, Singvad, Garbada, Devgadbaria, Gir Gadhada, Talala, Jodiya, Bhesan, Mendarda, Rapar, Nakhatrana, Lakhpat, Mandvi, Galteshwar, Matar, Vaso, Mahudha, Satlasana, Jotana, Kheralu, Becharaji, Vadnagar, Khanpur, Kadana, Virpur, Maliya, Garudeshwar, Dediapada, Tilakwada, Sagbara, Khergam, Ghoghamba, Morwa (Hadaf), Jambughoda, Shehera, Sarasvati, Santalpur, Shankheshwar, Sami, Radhanpur, Harij. 
  • Category II: Includes areas such as: Viramgam, Rajula, Bagasara, Amreli, Umreth, Kambhat, Borsad, Petlad, Meghraj, Bayad, Bhiloda, Modasa, Deesa, Bhabhar, Palanpur, Amod, Jambusar, Valia, Mahuva, Sihor. 3. Category III: Includes areas such as: Daskroi, Bavla, Dholka, Sanand, Mandal, Ahmedabad City, Anand, Jhagadia, Bharuch, Vagra, Anklesvar, Hansot, Bhavnagar, Khambalia, Kalol, Dehgam, Ghandinagar, Lalpur, Jamnagar, Junagadh, Junagadh City, Mundra, Anjar, Gandhidham, Kheda, Nadiad, Kadi, Mehsana, Wankaner, Morbi, Tankara, Navsari, Halol.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Signed copy of Application form
2. Copy of Udyam Registration (if applicable) 
3. Copy of the Constitution of the enterprise 
4. Copy of PAN Card of Enterprise 
5. Copy of PAN Card of Applicant/Promoters/Directors/partners and authorised signatory 
6. CA certificate for capital investment 
7. Land Document such as NA Permission/ copy of Index/sale deed 
8. Estimates of Power Distribution company (DISCOM) and receipt 
9. Copy of bills issued by Power Distribution company 
10. Copy of Power Distribution License company Certificate (High Tension / Low Tension) 
11. Copy of certificate for social category (if applicable) 
12. Copy of CA Certified Balance Sheet of the latest (if applicable) 
13. Copy of CA certified Shareholding pattern 
14. Copy of sanctioned and connected Load Certificate issued by Power Distribution License Company 
15. Self-certified expenditure statement supported by DISCOM documents 
16. Copy of GPCB approved NOC/Consent & other departments approval (if applicable) 
17. Bank details for payment (Cancelled cheque) 
18. Copy of GST registration (if applicable) 
19. Self-Attested documents/ details to be submitted by the Authorized Person 
20. Power of attorney/Board resolution/ Consent letter 
21. Supporting documents for SC/ST Enterprise
data.checklist_info_d:
Address:
Jadeja Dharmendrasinh,
